intro: Amsinckia brunnescens, commonly known as the desert tarplant, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Amsinckia brunnescens is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, which can improve soil fertility in its native environment.
